title: Canadabuster
subtitle:
Look how many homeless people died in Toronto shelters in 2018 because they had no housing or medical care. Now imagine the outrage if a single refugee were to die in the same conditions.

title: Charlie Hersh (they/them)
subtitle: Did you know #AASLH2019 is happening just a few blocks away from the first public memorial to the Holocaust? It's at 16th and Arch. The monument was created in 1964 by Nathan Rappaport, a Jewish Polish refugee. The surrounding plaza was installed in 2018. Check it out if you can! pic.twitter.com/psxQB4Z8cs

title: Dany Bahar
subtitle:
Yet, other crises received MUCH MORE int'l funding, crucial not only for humanitarian needs but also for investing in local infrastructure of host communities. 

In per capita terms, on avg, Venezuelan #refugees have received below $100 in funding. Syrians have received $5000. pic.twitter.com/SJYXYOwqeS

title: ASRC
subtitle: We were honoured today to stand as one with our amazing refugee and humanitarian sector, doctors, nurses, nuns and community advocates to do all we can to #SaveMedeVac.pic.twitter.com/j6HdPNbjSy

title: IslamicRelief Canada
subtitle: Two years ago, 700,000 refugees fled from the Rakhine province of #Myanmar to #Bangladesh. Since then, less than 200 people have returned to their villages, most of which have been razed down leaving only charred trees. 1/2pic.twitter.com/GhkPttffj5

title: U.S. Military Academy
subtitle: Nine cadets and one civilian instructor traveled to Chalkida, Greece this summer on @WestPointSOSH AIAD. For 3 weeks, they worked with the volunteer organization Cross-Cultural Solutions at the Ritsona Refugee Camp, which houses refugees from Syria and various African countries pic.twitter.com/VlpuRuIp1x

title: Jean-Nicolas Beuze
subtitle:
Burundi plans to repatriate its citizens who fled to Tanzania.

Returns must be voluntary & conditions in Burundi are not yet conducive to a safe return in dignity, says @Refugees.

Worth noting that our refugee response was the least funded last year.

title: Families of the 54th Massachusetts, Union Army
subtitle:
William Gibson served with Co. D under the alias John Saunders. He was recruited from Chatham, where many freedom seekers took refuge from kidnappers sanctioned by the Refugee Slave Act of 1850.

title: MOFA / MRE Angola
subtitle: The Governments of Angola and DRC, and the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees have struck a deal on the DRC refugees from the Angolan Province of Lunda Norte repatriation to the DRC. The Agreement was signed last night, in Luanda. pic.twitter.com/9LVS7mN3N4

title: Kenneth Roth
subtitle: The biggest non-surprise of the day: no Rohingya refugees want to return to Myanmar while they still face violence, persecution, and the denial of their citizenship. And no officer has been prosecuted for the atrocities that sent them fleeing. https://trib.al/eIVfnZjÂ pic.twitter.com/CeaBZRK5lP

title: Earth Day Network
subtitle: We have a mere 11 years to save ourselves, the climate refugees, and the millions of species awaiting their oblivion. Let this be a reminder that all of us can make a small change to save our blue planet  #EarthDay #EarthRisepic.twitter.com/sk4PYvanN7
